Keywords: Avengers , Cosmic , Deity , Martial Artist , Ruler , Warrior
Real Name: Jacques Duquesne
Special Powers
COTATI GENERAL: Friendly bystanders within range modify attack +1. // If a friendly character named Quoi is on the map, friendly bystanders within range modify defense +1.
SWORDSMAN'S SKILLS: Super Senses, but succeeds on a 4-6. // When Swordsman or an adjacent friendly character is missed by a close attack, after resolutions deal the attacker 1 penetrating damage.
MAKLUAN SWORD: Blades/Claws/Fangs. // FREE: Choose one. Swordsman can use the chosen effect until you choose again:
*Energy Explosion
*Incapacitate
*Penetrating/Psychic Blast
*Poison
*Precision Strike

Comments
November 4, 2022
Mysterydude5512
Pulled this guy in sealed. He cleaned up and the versatility of the Makluan Sword power made him even better. Power that stays til you pick again can be cheesed with some proper timing. Base somebody, choose poison at the end of turn, start next turn poison opponent, then switch to an attack power. Cosmic Energy is just gravy.
October 24, 2022
neilr1
We haven’t had common primes since WW80 and haven’t had uncommon primes since XMRF. XMRF was the first set of the new model of only having rare or super rare primes.
October 24, 2022
Oathful
So it looks like we're getting two rare primes instead of a common prime. As of writing this, we're only missing a couple of uncommons and quite a few super rares, so maybe they're shifting primes into the higher rarity slots. I'd love to go over my thoughts on that here, but this is about the figure, and this figure looks VERY enticing. If you aren't running him with Quoi, you're missing out on a lot of value since Quoi's bystanders are already really good, but with both him and Swordsman buffing them you end up flooding the map with characters that punch way above their paygrades. Even without the bystanders, his dial holds up extremely well, good stats with traited 50/50 Super Senses always hits hard. Mix that with being able to pick from some of the best attack powers to use, you have one hell of a "secondary" attacker for Quoi, with 125 points (if you run Quoi at 100 instead of 200) points of support left over with great keywords. // Thematic: ? (haven't read about them, so...), Viability: 10/10, Fun Factor: 8.5/10, leans towards biased-fun.
